duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide function-based treatments and interventions to patients in an inpatient setting.
Work one-on-one with patients to help them achieve continuous daily gains and independence.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams including occupational therapists, physical therapists, case management team, social workers, nursing staff, and physicians.
Create efficient treatment plans based on current evidence-based guidelines.
Foster an interdisciplinary team approach with dynamic and ongoing communication to provide well-rounded treatment to patients.
Build trust and communication with patients to ensure great satisfaction scores.
Serve as a clinical instructor for incoming students and provide peer mentorship.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of a Speech-Language Pathology program
Certificate of Clinical Competence through the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association
Basic Life Support Certification from the American Heart Association
